intro: Blepharis tanae, commonly known as the Tanae's beard-tongue, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often pink or purple and bloom during the cooler months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
